SENT.plain: Because of the rarity of dural sinus thrombosis in children with polycythaemia vera (PV), the options for diagnosis and treatment remain elusive
A 12-year-old girl was admitted with dural sinus thrombosis associated with PV, diagnosed by magnetic resonance venography
She was managed with interventional endovascular thrombolectomy and venoplasty, phlebotomy, hydroxyurea, low molecular weight heparin, and aspirin followed by warfarin
She made a good recovery without residual neurological deficit
This case highlights the importance of diagnosis and appropriate intervention with multi-modality treatments in patients with PV and thrombosis
